Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

::Kaiser::
       He nods slowly listening to Tyrael's plan.  "I am suitably impressed 
... though you're lacking a few critical details and suffer from a flawed 
assumption."  He walks to the table and sits down with his back to the door 
to seem less threatening.  "First off, although the Predacons might be 
temporarily confused by Hydras' death, it wouldn't stop them for long.  
Someone would fill the vacuum quickly enough."  He stops and thinks to 
himself for a moment.  "Yes, here's what we should do.  Go in, kill Hydras, 
making absolutely certain he is dead.  Then we pull back almost immediately.  
That way, once they have time to calm down a bit their command structure will 
truly destabilize.  In an emergency they'll fight their enemy... Without an 
enemy they'll fight themselves.  That is when we move in for the kill."  He 
smiles proud of himself.

       "Now then, killing Hydras will be no easy task.  Few could take him 
on, one on one, and live.  It is therefore my recommendation that you, 
Tyrael, and the Dragoon, team up to eliminate him while the rest of us 
provide cover from his followers."  He looks up at Tyrael for his opinion.  
"Well?"

--part1_172.1a521df6.2bf29e4b_boundary
